scene.name: start
scene.line: `(CATE gently rolls a fallen branch and plucks something white from the underside. She holds it up for EZRA to examine.)`
`Pleurocybella porrigens`. The common name is "angel wings." Isn't that pleasant? They have a delicate, springy texture, and they're tasty, like sweet moss.
Would you like a bite?
scene.option: Sweet moss doesn't sound very tasty to me ...

scene.name: eat-angel-wing
scene.line: `(EZRA takes a small bite and ruminates)`
What do you think?
scene.option: Is it supposed to be spicy?
I think I got a bug.

scene.name: angel-wing-spicy
scene.line: Um, no ... go ahead and spit that out, it's OK.

scene.name: angel-wing-bug
scene.line: Oh, lucky you.
I'm kidding, you can spit it out if you want.

scene.name: angel-wing-moss
scene.line: Personally, I like to be able to tell where my food came from, by flavor alone. I like to taste my surroundings, I mean. It keeps me connected to the ... the whole thing.

scene.name: mushroom-hunting-intro
scene.line: My mushroom-hunting mentor told me, "it's useless to pretend to know mushrooms; they escape your erudition; the more you know them, the less sure you feel about identifying them."
`(She taps the cover of the small red book she's carrying.)` That's why I always bring my favorite guidebook.
`(CATE points to a small mushroom growing in the dirt.)`

Oh, here's an important one to recognize, though. Look, see the sort of greenish pallor of the cap? `Amanita phalloides`. That's Greek: "amanita" means mushroom, and "phalloides" means, um ... never mind.

scene.name: amanita-edible
scene.line: Only once! It's deadly poisonous.

scene.name: amanita-smell
scene.line: Yeah. Sort of nauseating, though, right? Sickly-sweet.

scene.name: amanita-deadly
scene.line: "Death Cap," that's the common name. It's killed a lot of people, this little mushroom â€” including a few Roman emperors. It's a revolutionary! Ha ha.
Even the Buddha died from eating a mushroom, when he was very old. That's just what they do: clear away old things, make room for new things.
Pretty important, right? I've always thought they deserved a little more respect.
Would you like to help me look for a few more? I have a sort of shopping list.
Great. Look for ... actually, just grab any mushrooms that catch your eye and throw them in this bag. Let me know when you're done and we'll see what you've got!

scene.name: have-fun
scene.line: "Have fun!" That's the second rule of mushroom hunting. The first rule is "ask Cate before eating anything," OK?

scene.name: ezra-explores
scene.option: `(EZRA pokes around the base of a cypress tree.)`
`(EZRA checks out a plastic bag washed up on the island.)`

scene.name: rotting-stump
scene.line: `(The stump is ringed with overlapping shelves of mushrooms striped brown-blue-gray-white. A caterpillar crawls along one of them.)`
He didn't have any friends nearby; none of their new neighbors seemed to have children his age. So he played alone in the woods, alone, except for the deer.

scene.name: turkey-tail
scene.line: `(It smells spicy, sweet, mild; like how EZRA had expected his father's tobacco to taste, when he hastily chewed and swallowed a noxious fistful, and spent the afternoon retching in secret.)`
He heard someone calling his name; probably his mother, but her voice didn't sound right through the trees. He kept going.
scene.option: `(EZRA tears off a piece of the mushroom and puts it in his bag.)`

scene.name: cordyceps
scene.line: `(The caterpillar shuffles listlessly across the mushroom. It seems to be dragging several of its legs. An odd, brown-black thread protrudes about two inches out of its head.)`
He saw strange lights in the trees, flickering purple. He kept going.
scene.option: `(EZRA carefully picks up the caterpillar and puts it in his bag.)`

scene.name: base-of-tree
scene.line: `(A brownish clump of mushrooms feathers out from the base of the cypress tree. A few feet above, several pale blue puffs cling to the trunk.)`
The woods were full of deer.
His dad said the deer liked best to live on the edges of forests. Recent development in the area had created a lot of fresh edges, so they massed here and sometimes ran into the road.
scene.option: `(EZRA crouches to get a closer look at the brownish clump.)`

scene.name: sheeps-head
scene.line: `(The mushrooms look dried out and brittle, almost like tree bark.)`
He heard strange, gruff voices back in the direction of the house, and something that sounded like a choked sob or a sharp rebuke. He kept going.
scene.option: `(EZRA tears off a piece of the mushroom and puts it in his bag.)`

scene.name: puffball
scene.line: `(He prods one of the pale orbs with a stick, and it cracks open a little, releasing a fine dust into the air.)`
He felt like the world outside the woods had somehow slipped away while he was gone, and now there was nothing but the woods. He kept going.
scene.option: `(EZRA carefully removes a puffball, and puts it in his bag.)`

scene.name: plastic-bag
scene.line: `(The bag is ragged and waterlogged. He nudges it with a stick, coiling up a plastic thread and spreading it out on the beach.)`

He'd taken a knife from the kitchen, selected for its long, serrated edge. Meant for slicing bread, its teeth had reminded him of a saw blade. He was determined to collect some firewood to heat the house.
`(There are no mushrooms in the bag.)`

scene.name: done-hunting
scene.line: `(EZRA closes his eyes and listens to the water and the distant clicking of bats.)`

scene.name: reconnect-with-cate
scene.line: He tripped on a protruding root and lay for a while in the mud, examining the pale upper branches of a sycamore tree, listening to the soft rumble of a faraway thunderstorm, then louder, closer, and his hair stood on end, and there was the bird.

scene.name: memorial
scene.option: These are the only trees in this whole cave. Who planted them here?
What's this island for? It looks like someone made it on purpose.

scene.name: memorial-trees
scene.line: Right, not many trees down here in the dark ...
I know these are ... some kind of cypress. And they were definitely planted here deliberately, uh ... by someone who ...

scene.name: memorial-island
scene.line: Oh, right, it's kind of a nice, simple shape. Pleasantly minimal island geometry.
I'm sure it `could` be natural, though. I mean, I don't know if the island itself is man-made or not, but ...

scene.name: memorial-background
scene.line: I guess I don't know much about this place, really. It's supposed to be some kind of memorial? To something?
Will would know more.
Sorry, it's a mystery.

scene.name: wait-for-ezra-search
scene.line: `(EZRA kicks the dirt.)`

scene.name: cypress-tree
scene.line: `(The tree smells spicy, oily.)`

scene.name: edge-of-water
scene.line: `(EZRA steps on a plastic bottle. A wooden post projects from the sand nearby.)`

scene.name: large-rock
scene.line: `(The monument is covered with lichen and painted text.)`

scene.line: `(A message is carved in the bark.)`
OZY

scene.name: examine-trimmed-branches
scene.line: `(Some of the branches have been trimmed recently.)`

scene.name: examine-mooring-post
scene.line: `(A groove is worn near the top of the post.)`

scene.name: examine-plastic-bottle
scene.line: `(There's a scrap of paper inside the bottle. EZRA takes it out and reads it.)`
EGGS FLOUR CHARDONNAY LAXATIVES PAPER TOWELS SCRATCH TICKET

scene.line: X+O 4EVA

scene.name: examine-lichen
scene.line: `(Colorful lichen coats the surface of the monument, mixing with painted graffiti, in some places indistinguishably.)`

scene.name: done-searching-for-clues
scene.line: `(EZRA inspects the contents of his pockets.)`

scene.name: iron-pariah-appears
scene.line: `(CATE and EZRA look up at an old battleship drifting by.)`

scene.name: iron-pariah-done
scene.line: Ezra's parents shook him awake. They seemed alarmed, but not immediately concerned. They led him back to the house, past the house, into the car.
Dad said they were going to stay at the bus station for a while, the one with the little arcade, with the car game he liked.
Dad watched him closely in the rear-view mirror, expecting Ezra to be excited, or confused, or scared, but he didn't feel anything. He hardly seemed to hear.
In fact, he felt like he was observing the family car from a distance, from far above, from the clouds.

fragments.fragment: He didn't like to play in the house. It was always too cold. It seemed to store up the cold at night, then slowly discharge it into his bones during the day, while the sun bounced feebly off the windows.
But he liked to play in the woods behind the house.
